transportAdvice: Stone Town's historic center is compact and best explored on foot, though the narrow winding streets can be disorienting at first. Taxis and shared minibuses (dala-dalas) are widely available for reaching areas beyond the old town, and taxis can be negotiated directly with drivers at stands or through your accommodation.

weather.description: Hot and humid with mostly sunny skies and occasional brief showers, making it a popular time for beach visits.
One of the hottest and driest months, with strong sunshine and calm seas ideal for snorkeling and diving.
The long rains begin to approach, bringing increasing cloud cover and occasional heavy downpours alongside warm temperatures.
Peak of the long rainy season with frequent heavy rainfall and overcast skies; many beach activities are disrupted.
Still firmly in the rainy season with persistent showers and cooler temperatures; a quieter period for tourism.
Rains ease off and cooler, drier conditions arrive, making it a comfortable and pleasant time to explore the town.
Cool and dry with reliable sunshine and refreshing sea breezes; one of the most comfortable months for sightseeing.
Similar to July with dry, sunny weather and mild temperatures; a peak tourist month with busy streets and beaches.
Temperatures begin to rise again with continued dry and sunny conditions, offering excellent visibility for water activities.
The short rains begin to build, bringing occasional afternoon showers but generally still warm and partly sunny days.
Short rainy season is in full swing with frequent afternoon and evening downpours and high humidity throughout the day.
Rains begin to taper off toward month's end, with warm temperatures returning and conditions improving for outdoor exploration.
